snippet: Senate leaders are eager to avoid a freewheeling, unpredictable debate on Congressional ethics.
abstract: Senate leaders, eager to avoid a freewheeling, unpredictable debate on Congressional ethics, are considering simply accepting a House-passed bill to ban insider trading by lawmakers; this approach would kill two provisions previously passed by the Senate and would, in the eyes of some, weaken the measure promoted as a way to restore trust in Congress.
lead_paragraph: Senate leaders are eager to avoid a freewheeling, unpredictable debate on Congressional ethics.

headline.main: Senate to Choose an Insider Trading Bill
headline.print_headline: Senate to Choose an Insider Trading Bill
